meanings.definition: The act of dividing something into two equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The bisection of the cake made it easy to share with my friend.
meanings.sent2: The bisection of the orange was done neatly down the middle.
meanings.sent3: During the bisection of the pizza, the toppings got all mixed up!
meanings.sent4: The bisection of the soccer field by the white line created two equal halves.
meanings.sent5: The bisection of the sandwich into two triangles made it look fancy.

meanings.definition: A line or plane that divides something into two equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The bisection on the map showed the exact center of the forest.
meanings.sent2: The bisection of the mirror by the crack made it look like two separate pieces.
meanings.sent3: The bisection of the road by the fallen tree caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: The bisection of the painting by the diagonal line added depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The bisection of the garden by the path created two distinct areas for flowers.
